item.title: Gilt Yields Fall After Weaker UK Inflation Data Takes Pressure Off BOE
item.description: Gilt yields fell after U.K. inflation data for August was weaker than expected, taking pressure off the BOE to deliver more interest-rate rises to tackle inflation, even as an increase at Thursday’s meeting remains likely.

item.title: UK House Builders Shares Surge on Surprise Easing of Inflation
item.description: Shares in U.K. house builders Barratt Developments, Taylor Wimpey and Persimmon surged in early trading after consumer price index inflation undershot market expectations.

item.title: Dollar Could Rise if Fed Hints at Possible Further Rate Increases
item.description: The dollar could rise after the Fed’s policy announcement, even as interest rates are expected to be left unchanged at 5.25%-5.50%, if there are hints rates could increase further, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Ukrainian Tactics Put Russia on the Defensive in the Black Sea
item.description: Using innovative attacks, Ukraine has eroded Russia’s formidable naval advantage and is starting to reopen ports.

item.title: U.K. Inflation Drops Unexpectedly
item.description: Consumer prices in the U.K. rose 6.7% on year in August, while the core rate decelerated to 5.9%, giving the Bank of England more room to maneuver ahead of its interest-rate decision this week.

item.title: Glynn's Take: Australia's El Niño Event Could Be a Storm for the RBA
item.description: A day after RBA Gov. Michele Bullock’s arrival at the helm of the central bank, meteorologists declared that an El Niño event, the first in eight years, is under way.

item.title: Azerbaijan began an offensive against what it said were Armenian military targets in the contested Nagorno-Karabakh region, an escalation that threatens to tip the two former Soviet states into a full-blown conflict.
item.description: Azerbaijan began an offensive against what it said were Armenian military targets in the contested Nagorno-Karabakh region, an escalation that threatens to tip the two former Soviet states into a full-blown conflict.

item.title: Pregnant women should be screened for hypertensive disorders at every prenatal visit, government-backed medical experts recommended, urging doctors to do more to reach people at risk for increasingly common threats to maternal health.
item.description: Pregnant women should be screened for hypertensive disorders at every prenatal visit, government-backed medical experts recommended, urging doctors to do more to reach people at risk for increasingly common threats to maternal health.

item.title: India ordered a Canadian diplomat to leave the country as the rift deepened between New Delhi and Ottawa over the killing of a Sikh separatist on Canadian soil.
item.description: India ordered a Canadian diplomat to leave the country as the rift deepened between New Delhi and Ottawa over the killing of a Sikh separatist on Canadian soil.

item.title: House Republican leaders worked to salvage a short-term spending bill that sparked angry disagreements among the party's rank-and-file, but they remained short of the support needed to pass the measure and show the party could unite to avert a government shutdown.
item.description: House Republican leaders worked to salvage a short-term spending bill that sparked angry disagreements among the party’s rank-and-file, but they remained short of the support needed to pass the measure and show the party could unite to avert a government shutdown.

item.title: Defense Secretary Austin said the U.S. and its allies need to focus on providing Ukraine with more air defense, artillery and mechanized equipment ahead of a long-awaited Biden administration decision on providing Kyiv with longer-range firepower.
item.description: Defense Secretary Austin said the U.S. and its allies need to focus on providing Ukraine with more air defense, artillery and mechanized equipment ahead of a long-awaited Biden administration decision on providing Kyiv with longer-range firepower.

item.title: Presidents Biden and Zelensky, addressing the U.N. General Assembly, called on their counterparts to defend the idea that powerful nations can't seize territory from their neighbors, part of a broad appeal aimed at isolating Russia on the world stage.
item.description: Presidents Biden and Zelensky, addressing the U.N. General Assembly, called on their counterparts to defend the idea that powerful nations can’t seize territory from their neighbors, part of a broad appeal aimed at isolating Russia on the world stage.

item.title: Thai Credit Bank Taps Investors Ahead of IPO
item.description: Thai Credit Bank is in talks with investors ahead of plans to raise as much as $300 million in an initial public offering in Thailand.

item.title: Pearson Names New CEO
item.description: Pearson has appointed Omar Abbosh as CEO, effective early 2024, succeeding Andy Bird, who will retire.

item.title: AstraZeneca, Pfizer Agree Rare-Disease Deal
item.description: AstraZeneca’s Alexion unit has completed a purchase and license agreement for an early-stage rare-disease gene therapy portfolio from Pfizer for $1 billion.

item.title: Cathay Pacific's Passenger Numbers Rose Sharply
item.description: Cathay Pacific Airways’ passenger numbers rose sharply in August, and said the overall outlook for the rest of 2023 appears promising.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: Beijing Touts China's Economic Resilience
item.description: China’s top economic policy makers on Wednesday struck back against widespread pessimism about the country’s growth trajectory as Beijing sought to boost business confidence amid persisting headwinds.

item.title: Britain's Pitch to Investors: We're Boring Now---and That's Good
item.description: Investment in the U.K. is rising again as Treasury chief Jeremy Hunt and his prime minister manage to make Britain predictable again.

item.title: America's Biggest Landlords Can't Find Houses to Buy Either
item.description: Higher rates and few properties for sale have slowed Wall Street’s home buying.
